avdta.network.node

Class TrafficSignal

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.node.IntersectionControl
      • avdta.network.node.TrafficSignal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Signalized

    public class TrafficSignal
extends IntersectionControl
implements Signalized
    This class implements traffic signals at intersections (Node) of a network.
    A signal has Phases, each of which has a PhaseMovement for a specified period of time in a cycle.
    List<Phase> phases: is a list of all the phases in the signals, which defines the turning movements allowed in each phase.
    curr_idx tells the current phase of the signal.
    curr_time is the current time in the phase.
    total_time is the cycle time.
    turns maps an incoming link to a mapping which maps an outgoing link to a PhaseMovement.

      boolean hasConflictRegions()
      Returns if the signal has conflicting regions, which it has (always), and so it returns true.
      void initialize()
      Resets the current phase and the current time to 0, inserts the mapping of the phase movements in turns, and sets the start time of each phase in the cycle.
      void reset()
      Resets the current phase and the current time to 0, and sets the flow q of the outgoing link of the turn movement to 0.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Link i,
                       Link j,
                       DriverType driver)
        Checks if the given pair of links in a turning movement is involved in the phases at the signal; if not, movement from i to j is not allowed. Movement is also allowed if one of the links is a centroid connector.
        Specified by:
        canMove in class IntersectionControl
        Parameters:
        i - Incoming link.
        j - Outgoing link,
        driver - AV or HV.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the input links are involved in the phase or if at least one of the input links is a centroid connector.

      • calcGreenTime

        public void calcGreenTime()
        Maps the green time of the various phases to the discretized time setting.

      • step

        public int step()
        Implements a time-step of movement of vehicles at the intersection with the signal. Vehicles that do not have a next Link (some buses) are removed from the network. Vehicles that move are removed from their previous Link (Link.removeVehicle(avdta.vehicle.Vehicle) and added to their next Link (Link.addVehicle(avdta.vehicle.Vehicle)). This requires that Vehicle.getPrevLink() is the incoming Link and Vehicle.getNextLink() is the outgoing Link.
        Specified by:
        step in class IntersectionControl
        Returns:
        Returns the number of vehicle which has exited the network.
